about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

hasPart.name: You want to park uphill on a two-way road and there is no curb. Which direction do you turn your front wheels?

about.name: You want to park uphill on a two-way road and there is no curb. Which direction do you turn your front wheels?

hasPart.assesses: You want to park uphill on a two-way road and there is no curb. Which direction do you turn your front wheels? | You want to park uphill on a two-way road and there is no curb. Which direction do you turn your front wheels? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: When parking either uphill or downhill on a road that has no curb, you should turn your wheels so that the vehicle will roll away from the center of the road if the brakes fail.

comment.text: Straight ahead

suggestedAnswer.text: Right, toward the side of the road

comment.text: Right, toward the side of the road

suggestedAnswer.text: Left, toward the center of the road

comment.text: Left, toward the center of the road

acceptedAnswer.text: Right, toward the side of the road

comment.text: Right, toward the side of the road

answerExplanation.text: When parking either uphill or downhill on a road that has no curb, you should turn your wheels so that the vehicle will roll away from the center of the road if the brakes fail.

comment.text: You want to park uphill on a two-way road and there is no curb. Which direction do you turn your front wheels? | When parking either uphill or downhill on a road that has no curb, you should turn your wheels so that the vehicle will roll away from the center of the road if the brakes fail.

educationalAlignment.targetDescription: You want to park uphill on a two-way road and there is no curb. Which direction do you turn your front wheels? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
educationalAlignment.targetName: You want to park uphill on a two-way road and there is no curb. Which direction do you turn your front wheels?

hasPart.name: What is the difference between traffic lights with red arrows and those with solid red lights?

about.name: What is the difference between traffic lights with red arrows and those with solid red lights?

hasPart.assesses: What is the difference between traffic lights with red arrows and those with solid red lights? | What is the difference between traffic lights with red arrows and those with solid red lights? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: You may sometimes turn right when stopped by a solid red light. You may never turn left or right when stopped by a traffic light with a red arrow.

suggestedAnswer.text: Red arrows are only used to stop traffic which is turning.

comment.text: Red arrows are only used to stop traffic which is turning.

suggestedAnswer.text: Red arrows are only used for protected turn lanes.

comment.text: Red arrows are only used for protected turn lanes.

suggestedAnswer.text: You cannot turn on a red arrow, even if you stop first.

comment.text: You cannot turn on a red arrow, even if you stop first.

acceptedAnswer.text: You cannot turn on a red arrow, even if you stop first.

comment.text: You cannot turn on a red arrow, even if you stop first.

answerExplanation.text: You may sometimes turn right when stopped by a solid red light. You may never turn left or right when stopped by a traffic light with a red arrow.

comment.text: What is the difference between traffic lights with red arrows and those with solid red lights? | You may sometimes turn right when stopped by a solid red light. You may never turn left or right when stopped by a traffic light with a red arrow.

educationalAlignment.targetDescription: What is the difference between traffic lights with red arrows and those with solid red lights? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
educationalAlignment.targetName: What is the difference between traffic lights with red arrows and those with solid red lights?

hasPart.name: When entering the interstate, check for a gap in traffic in the nearest lane, adjust your speed to match traffic, signal, and:

about.name: When entering the interstate, check for a gap in traffic in the nearest lane, adjust your speed to match traffic, signal, and:

hasPart.assesses: When entering the interstate, check for a gap in traffic in the nearest lane, adjust your speed to match traffic, signal, and: | When entering the interstate, check for a gap in traffic in the nearest lane, adjust your speed to match traffic, signal, and: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Before merging into interstate traffic, you should identify a gap, accelerate to the speed of traffic, and signal. Merge into the gap when it is safe to do so. Be alert to other traffic and do not expect other drivers to clear the lane.

suggestedAnswer.text: Expect traffic to allow you to proceed into the lane, since you have the right-of-way.

comment.text: Expect traffic to allow you to proceed into the lane, since you have the right-of-way.
Merge carefully into the gap.

suggestedAnswer.text: Wait for the lane to clear before merging.

comment.text: Wait for the lane to clear before merging.
Merge carefully into the gap.

answerExplanation.text: Before merging into interstate traffic, you should identify a gap, accelerate to the speed of traffic, and signal. Merge into the gap when it is safe to do so. Be alert to other traffic and do not expect other drivers to clear the lane.

comment.text: When entering the interstate, check for a gap in traffic in the nearest lane, adjust your speed to match traffic, signal, and: | Before merging into interstate traffic, you should identify a gap, accelerate to the speed of traffic, and signal. Merge into the gap when it is safe to do so. Be alert to other traffic and do not expect other drivers to clear the lane.

hasPart.name: This sign means:
hasPart.assesses: This sign means: | This sign means: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: This sign indicates that turns in the direction of the arrow (in this case, to the right) are prohibited.

comment.text: No right turn.
Stop sign ahead.
Divided highway.
No right turn.

answerExplanation.text: This sign indicates that turns in the direction of the arrow (in this case, to the right) are prohibited.

comment.text: This sign means: | This sign indicates that turns in the direction of the arrow (in this case, to the right) are prohibited.

hasPart.name: It is illegal to park your vehicle:

about.name: It is illegal to park your vehicle:

hasPart.assesses: It is illegal to park your vehicle: | It is illegal to park your vehicle: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: It is illegal to park your car on a marked or unmarked crosswalk. You may park in a bicycle lane if there is not a "No parking" sign posted and your vehicle does not block a bicyclist.

comment.text: In an unmarked crosswalk.

suggestedAnswer.text: Within three feet of a private driveway.

comment.text: Within three feet of a private driveway.
In a bicycle lane.
In an unmarked crosswalk.

answerExplanation.text: It is illegal to park your car on a marked or unmarked crosswalk. You may park in a bicycle lane if there is not a "No parking" sign posted and your vehicle does not block a bicyclist.

comment.text: It is illegal to park your vehicle: | It is illegal to park your car on a marked or unmarked crosswalk. You may park in a bicycle lane if there is not a "No parking" sign posted and your vehicle does not block a bicyclist.

hasPart.name: Extra space in front of a large truck is needed for:

about.name: Extra space in front of a large truck is needed for:

hasPart.assesses: Extra space in front of a large truck is needed for: | Extra space in front of a large truck is needed for: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Because they are larger, trucks take longer to stop than cars traveling at the same speed. Other drivers should not pull in front of a truck and then slow down or stop.

suggestedAnswer.text: Other drivers to merge onto the freeway.

comment.text: Other drivers to merge onto the freeway.

suggestedAnswer.text: The truck driver to stop the vehicle.

comment.text: The truck driver to stop the vehicle.

suggestedAnswer.text: Other drivers when they want to slow down.

comment.text: Other drivers when they want to slow down.

acceptedAnswer.text: The truck driver to stop the vehicle.

comment.text: The truck driver to stop the vehicle.

answerExplanation.text: Because they are larger, trucks take longer to stop than cars traveling at the same speed. Other drivers should not pull in front of a truck and then slow down or stop.

comment.text: Extra space in front of a large truck is needed for: | Because they are larger, trucks take longer to stop than cars traveling at the same speed. Other drivers should not pull in front of a truck and then slow down or stop.
